rule: The output must contain explanatory text, not just the category name.
input: Artificial intelligence reshapes industry: categorized as Sci/Tech due to innovation
output: Sci/Tech: "Artificial intelligence reshapes industry: categorized as Sci/Tech due to innovation"
complianceText:
The chatbot output provides a classification of a news article. The output explicitly assigns the category "Sci/Tech" to the given text snippet "Artificial intelligence reshapes industry." This aligns with the description which includes 'Sci/Tech' as one of the categories into which news articles can be classified. Since the output presents the category and an explanation why it was classified there, it complies with the format indicated in the examples given in the description. The description requires an output mentioning a category explicitly, which the output provides clearly.

OK
